Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: kimmenHelsinki
Reviews.Content: but the superior room we paid and got was not so big, but otherwise the location is great and about 300 m from the hotel you have Lidl and Netto shops;) and Stefan was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with quiet location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: disa S
Reviews.Content: Just 20m from the Märkisches Museum subway station. Take the U2-line that goes between Pankow and Ruhleben, if you come from Alexanderplatz it's only a few stops. Very nice neighborhood! This was the first time I took my mother with me on a short trip, so we chose a hotel that would satisfy both needs. The room is spacious and well-cleaned. We stayed in a room with shared kitchenette, don't know if it's like that in every room, but we were very pleased with the accommodation. The fact that the subway is so close makes it easy to reach different parts of the city. I've been to Berlin earlier when i interrailed last summer, that time we chose the hostel called 36rooms in Kreuzberg (which by the way is ''the'' place to choose if you want a cheap hostel with friendly atmosphere) so I wanted to show her a little bit of Kreuzberg. I think xberg is the best part of the city when it comes to food, atmosphere and shops..well almost anything! Back to the hotel; the room has a large wardrobe, comfy beds, TV with lots of channels to choose from, a minibar (with 2 free beers and 2 free bottles of water) and not a sign of dirt or whatsoever. I give this hotel 5/5, but we didn't spend the 16e (!) on breakfast, with that amount you expect something special but I've heard that it doesn't stand up to the 16e-standards... haha! PS. if you like sushi, try the restaurant that can be find on Dircksen str., next to the Alexa -shopping mall. If you're in to Indian cuisine, go over the bridge and about 100m straight forward and then turn left, there's a restaurant called Pooja close to the Novotel-hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dougie A
Reviews.Content: Small hotel directly opposite the subway giving you easy access to all of Berlin.Quiet with a canal on one side and little traffic noise at night.We didn't take the breakfast at 16 Euros but found a great little breakfast cafe 200 Metres away called Millies which does a great fresh brew and breakfast for a fiver.Staff in hotel were very helpful and our room on second floor was exactly what you would expect from a 4 star in a large city.There is an in house indian restaurant but we preferred to go to the city centre so cannot comment on it.We were more than happy with our choice of Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: PanhandleTraveler84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Derag Hotel Henriette in May of 2011 and never got around to voicing my satisfaction on here until now. While some details are a little blurry a year removed, I do know that I was extremely satisfied with the comfort and service I received at this hotel. The room, while it was very small (just like most European hotels), had everything I needed in a hotel spending most of my day sight seeing in Berlin. The bed was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom/shower space was great and very comfortable for an American who is used to having much more space in a hotel shower. The shower stall was fully inclosed (not usually the case for a lot of European hotel showers/bathtubs). The room included a great closet space for clothes with a safe to keep valuables as well as a comfortable desk area to sit down and review some work emails on the laptop. I remember that the metro stop was as convenient as it gets. Literally a stones throw from the hotel front door. And any major tourist/sight seeing stop was within 20 minutes or so. All in all, a great hotel for a 4 night stay in this great German city.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better options in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DavidLFisher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here and several other hotels in Berlin. I simply cannot recommend this property for a variety of reasons. #1 - Amenities did not work and the handling of this was unprofessional It turned out my refrigerator did not work. As I had checked in quite late and purchased a few items for later consumption, I went to the front desk to let the night manager know. Rather than move me to a room with functioning equipment, he simply said, 'maybe it is best to put it outside the window. It is quite cold out, so that should work.' #2 - Lack of follow-up After replacing the refrigerator in the morning (a half hour task) when it would have been simpler to move me, they did not check to see if it was working later. Unfortunately, neither did I, but I am the customer. My food spoiled. #3 - television went on the blink. after waiting half an hour for them to come up, they went through the same swapping gear derby, only to find it did not work, but was rather a problem with their server downstairs. #4 - the washers and dryers for customers They weren't working, so I had to hump my clothes to their sister property across the road. not a far walk, but still, unprofessional To to all that off, their 'double bed' was two twin beds shoved together. That is not a good sleep. Simply put, the staff needs better training to make this property viable

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mats M
Reviews.Content: Nicely sized and well equipped rooms. Beds of excellent quality. Situated close to Alexanderplatz on Line 2 of the U-bahn. Station just outside the door. Very friendly staff. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Clubbing in november”
Reviews.Author: snaris
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, helpful staff. Big spacious rooms with small kitchenette, big fridge, nice bathroom.Perfect location both for museums and clubbing. Near an U-bahn. Didn't eat the breakfast so I dunno about that. 24h-desk

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: argonauta89
Reviews.Content: we spent 7 days in this hotel, and had a wonderful time. It is really near the underground station (markisches museum), you just have to cross the road to get there, and if you wanna walk it's really near to alexanderplatz and other interesting spot in the city. We had two bottles of water and two bottles of beer every day and the room was always perfectly clean and had all the space we needed. The staff was extremely helpful, providing us with directions if we had any problem getting somewhere. The room is provided with a safe with your personal password, and hair dryer. If I'll ever come back to berlin (and I hope so because I really enjoyed everything in the city) I'll definitely come back to Derag Henriette!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel, it was clean, tidy and well presented. Rooms were large with good cooking facilities. Very close to subway and within walking distance of city sights. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay..”
Reviews.Author: Nikos K
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights, with my wife, on holiday. Ideally situated, the Uban is literally across the street, and only 6 min away fm AlexanderPlatz. Clean room, very quite, (we had a 2nd floor, river side view, room) Quite roomy, good mattress, the pillow is a bit of a problem with ALL german hotels (i suppose the Germans like it this way, chancy but soft!) and the 2 separate quilts on the double bed again is a standard all across Germany (and Austria) - and I still wonder why! the only down side is the wifi, which is 1 hr/day free (which should otherwise be enough for me) but has to be in one "go" ie one cannot chk email frequently during the day for free... I mention this also to emphasis that there are no serious -ve comments.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here...”
Reviews.Author: kdowell
Reviews.Content: I originally wrote a review from the room but it didn't go through so now I have to work off of a week old memory. I have no complaints. Its a nice hotel. The company seems to own the hotel Derag and Henriette so make sure you're at the right one. Take the UBahn to Markisches Museum and when you exit the station the door to the hotel is barely across the street. There are two restaurants and a market on the same street of the very quite area. The station is one or two away from the Hauptbanhof. The room was overlooking a small part of a river. There was a decent sized television, two complimentary Becks, two complimentary bottles of water, coffee and tea. The bathroom was quite large and nice and there was ample closet space. I actually recall thinking that they sacrificed sleeping/living space for a large bathroom and closet. All in all, I have no complaints. My travel buddy who had never been to Europe before also thought it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Henriette”
Reviews.Author: Carolus
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel close to the Maerkische Museum U-Bahn (Metro) station and a bus stop. The room was of adequate size and the bathroom was huge but had no shower curtains, which meant that the entire floor became wet when showering. It had a nice kitchen facility with a refrigerator two burners, a coffee pot and a hot water heater. Everything was very clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel very close to metro station”
Reviews.Author: monymontana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in mitte, which is a very nice area in berlin, close to the metro station , and you walk to Alexander platz from there and the surroundings areas, rooms wer nice size and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOXA61
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Large and comfortable with a kitchenette. Good beds. Service: The breakfast buffet was good and had most things you would expect for breakfast. Breakfast is served until 10 on week days and until 10:30 on week ends. The only minus I can think of is that there were no soft drinks for sale in the reception. Soft drinks could be bought in a small shop just 100 meters from the hotel so it didn't really matter. Area: Very quiet but central. There is an U-bahn station outside the hotel so local transport is no problem whatsoever. Alexanderplatz and Unter den Linden within walking distance. There were many German style restaurants (and a few other) a short walk from the hotel and there is an Indian restaurant in the hotel. The area is very quiet at night and for bars, cafes and restaurants we had to go to Hackescher Markt (within walking distance) or take the U-bahn to Prenzlauer Berg or Friedrichshain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: NunoD
Reviews.Content: There are only two things I (we) regret: the first is that breakfast wasn't included (and was really expensive!); and the second is that the wifi was free for only 1 hour a day. Besides that, the hotel was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Frendly staff, clean, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: scotty30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is i located next to the undeground, only a few stop from most places of interest. Taxi from airport cost us around 22euros each way. Staff are very friendly and helpfull, rooms are clean maybe a little smaller than other 4 star hotels rooms i have stayed in in Germany. we got this hotel at a much lower rate than many other 4 star hotels in centeral Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: GottoParis
Reviews.Content: Got a special promotional rate on this hotel but would be happy to pay their full rate in future as the hotel was GREAT! Loved absolutely everything about it & have even booked to go back there next year. Underground station literally a stone's throw but many sights within walking distance. Great café 5 minutes away (Milly's?) for good value breakfast & great coffee. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: Msian_traveller78
Reviews.Content: over-rated hotel, not so great. staff was not friendly, room was so hot as there was no aircondition, asked for a fan and they say it is all taken by other guests. i think in summer the hotels should provide some kind of cooling device. i was on the 1st floor and when i opened the window it was very noisy and difficult to sleep, lucky i was there only for one night. rooms were small and i did not feel it is value for money at all

Reviews.Title: “Good value near musuems”
Reviews.Author: WalkersWA
Reviews.Content: (There are two hotels – this is the cheaper one.) Good sized rooms, good bed, good facilities, and only an extra 10 mins walk from the museums as compared to the more expensive hotels. Bathroom a good size, but shower stall is small (no bath). Main issues are no air conditioning or room fan, so is hot in summer. At least the windows can be opened and the streets are generally quiet at night. Good eateries and a supermarket nearby. Recommended for those wanting to stay in the museum district for a lower cost.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfy room, and what a location!”
Reviews.Author: salks
Reviews.Content: Staff were really helpful, the room was small but clean and well furnished and the bed was incredibly comfortable. What else do you need? It is perfectly placed to explore the main attractions of central Berlin, we had an absolute blast using this as our base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: sloehand
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, just 2 stops by u-bahn from Alexanderplatz and the TV tower Nice breakfast buffet (I ate quite a bit too much every morning) Serviceminded staff: when we arrived, I was directed to free parking (kerb side, a few hundred yards away) inspite of the hotels arrangement with a nearby parking garage (at €17,- pr night) Nice and clean room with minibar, trouser press, electric kettle and so on Downsides: No A/C

Reviews.Title: “can do better”
Reviews.Author: mantse
Reviews.Content: location is wonderful which only 10 sec to U-bahn and can found supermarket and main scenry place in 10-15mins. the problem is air-con is not enough. i slept on the 2nd floor which i feel hot..... a electric fan was given later by their staff after i called the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: BaldwinNL
Reviews.Content: The 4 stars the hotel is boasting are overrated to say at least. Main reasons in my opinion are: A: no air conditioning in the room, and lots of noise when opening the window when you try to get the temp down to a level people under 60 might like. B: very small bathroom, with few amenities. No place for the towels other than in the shower so they'd get wet when taking one, or are on the floor, waiting for you. C: No wi-fi On the plus side: the rooms are very clean, and most of the staff, first hesitant, turned out to be very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: EPT
Reviews.Content: After a long search for hotels in Berlin, and finding most hotels quite expensive without breakfast, I decided for the first time to use hotwire.com. We ended up with Derag Hotel Henriette. The location is good and safe. The cost of taxi from/to Tegel Airport was about 20-25 Euros. The U-bahn is just in front of the hotel. The walk to Alexanderplatz takes about 10 minutes. We like to walk a lot and did find Berlin quite manageable and not so big when it comes to seeing the biggest sites. The staff was prompt and friendly. The breakfast had many choices, but they didn't manage to keep everything full at times. But we never went out hungry. We payed at bit more for an upgrade overlooking the river, which should be a bit more quiet. But frankly the location is on a street with not much traffic at all. We did have a kitchenette, that we didn't use. The beds were comfy, although they have two beds put together. The bathroom with a tub was clean, so I even used the tub, which I usually don't do. Would stay here again for the price, location and included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Bevla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and situated in perfect distance of AlexanderPlatz and there is a very handy U-Bahn just outside the front door. The rooms are lovely, comfortable and clean not huge but big enough, not all rooms have a bath so if you want one you should ask but the bathroom itself is spacious and well lit with lots of mirrors. The staff however are terribly rude and unhelpful. When we checked in we weren't told simple things such as check out time, breakfast timings (especcially as we went over a bank holiday as breakfast time is different to normal). We weren't told about being able to use the bar at the sister hotel over the road and we weren't told to bring our guest passes with us otherwise they grumble at you when you ask for your key back after being out. When checking out we were told that the luggage store was full and they had no where to store our bags, although when we pressed the point they told us we could use the luggage store over the road, why were we not automatically given that option? Also we asked reception to book us a cab to the airport although when we got back to our hotel after being out for the morning we were told someone else had taken our car and she had failed to book us another one!!! We were there at the time we had requested the car for after all... Also the restaurant at the hotel, whilst supplying very yummy indian food (no onion bhajis though!) the service is terrible. We waited about an hour for our dinner, thankfully we weren't in a rush. After dinner we stayed in the restaurant for another couple of hours (as there is no bar in the hotel that is ever used) and we weren't asked once if we wanteed another drink. Everytime we beckoned the waiter over to ask for a drink he acted as if we were causing him great difficulty! and these are just some of the problems we encountered with the staff........!! To round it off I entirely recommend the location and the hotel rooms etc but not the service they provide, maybe try the hotel over the road??!! P.S if planning on going over new year be careful of everyone throwing fireworks in the street. Even out of their apartment windows! Scary!

Reviews.Title: “Good quite spot”
Reviews.Author: donchaplin
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel to explore Berlin from but being far enough off the beaten track to be as quite as a church mouse at night. The hotel claims to have a bar but saw no eveidence of it though its sister hotel across the roads does so if you have young kids and you want to sit and have a night cap before going to bed this may not be for you. Rooms are fine not large but certainly big enough, again very quiet and spotless clean.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: skelghyl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel 20m from an U-Bahn station but in a quiet part of former East Berlin then this is the place for you. The public transport in Berlin is second to none and this hotel is ideal to benefit from that. Rooms are comfortable and breakfast is plentiful setting you up for a day's sightseeing. When we were there between Christmas and New Year the bar was closed although it looked as if it had been closed for a while. You can use the bar facilites across the road in the sister hotel so not really an inconvenience. There was an Indian restaurant attached to the hotel which is fine if you can't be bothered to go out in the evening and we used it on arrival day for that reason. Good selection of restaurants in the Nicholai quarter which is a short walk away. But the location and the ease of use of the U-Bahn were the highlights for me.

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly go back to the Henriette!”
Reviews.Author: BaselLisa
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Henriette through the Berlin tourism office's site and were a bit dubious as to what kind of hotel we'd get for 67 euros. But it was only for one night, the other reviews on Trip Advisor were good, so we'd go for it. During the week, it seems to be much more expensive, so we came to the conclusion that it's primarily a business hotel that offers great weekend deals. What a lovely surprise! As others have pointed out, it's very well located, with a U-bahn station right outside, and easy walking distance to all the main sights of East Berlin. Our welcome was very friendly and professional. Our room was a decent size, not huge, spotlessly clean and well-equipped (hairdryer, fan, kettle, minibar etc). Because of its location, it was nice and quiet. The hotel itself was tastefully and elegantly decorated. When we were leaving, the receptionist was extremely helpful, even printing out timetables from the web to make sure we caught the right train to the airport. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel. I filled out their in-room questionnaire and was delighted to receive a follow-up message in the mail a few days later, inviting us to come and stay again. We certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “A central Hotel although in the East”
Reviews.Author: Malroamer
Reviews.Content: Going to a new destination and knowing little about it makes booking an hotel difficult and can be worrying. As our son is living in Berlin he recommended the Dreag Henriette as it was the closest hotel to his apartment. He had not been inside but was told that the hotel was little known being in the East and off the beaten tourist map, but value for money. It is certainly value for money and compares well with UK hotel prices. The Hotel is not the Ritz but is comfortable, extremely clean, excellent breakfast, good and attentive service and staff speak enough English to understand and be understood. The only adverse comment I can make is that the coffee and tea supplies in the room were not replenished without asking and unfortunately there was not enough information about the room facilities and how to use them. Staff were frindly but not pushy, a good point. Bearing in mind the closeness to the U-bahn, twenty yards would be too far, the hotel suddenly becomes very accessible and convenient to all central points. Two stops to Alexanderplatz and Berlin becomes a smaller city. If we return to Berlin, the Henriette wold be first choice, but I think that it is becoming known and seems to enjoy good occupancy, which would mean early booking. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and well located but poor decoration”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: The Derag Henriette is well located in East Berlin, near the main museums in a quiet (maybe too much?) area. However, it is just at a subway station which makes it a good point to discover the rest of the city (Berlin has one of the best public transport system I ever experienced). The staff is quite nice, but they did not anticipate our needs. Arriving late in the evening, our room was very hot due to an external temperature of 30C all day long and we realised that there was no fixed A/C unit available. However, the next day they came to fit in a mobile A/C unit which changed a lot the comfort. Otherwise, I found both the room and the bathroom a bit small for this category of hotel, but everything was new, very clean, soundproof and operational. Breakfast was good. The decoration is very much on the conservative side with a lot of very ugly and cheap looking paintings. But it still was a good value at 93 € per night for 2 with breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: runcible
Reviews.Content: The hotel is of modest size, spotlessly clean, with courteous and efficient reception staff. My room was more than adequate, with a mini-bar, small kitchen area (microwave, sink, one or two stovetop burners, cookware), a well-appointed bathroom, and even a tiny balcony. And it was quiet. When I wanted to make a drink in my room I was unable to find ice, and was surprised that the front desk could not provide any. Since the Henriette does not have a regular bar it was suggested that I go to the bar at the related Derag Grosser Kurfuerst directly across the street. This minor inconvenience I simply note, since it did not detract from my comfortable stay at the Henriette. When I arrived in Berlin I took the S-Bahn from Schonfeld train station (the Hauptbahnhof having been temporarily knocked out by the big storm) to Alexanderplatz then, not really knowing exactly where I was, I took a short taxi ride to the my hotel. It turns out that the Derag Henriette is located just a few yards from an U-Bahn stop, and only a few blocks from Unter Den Linden. It was a pleasant walk to the Berliner Dom, and thence to the Brandenburg Gate, and I suppose it would have been not a bad walk back to Alexanderplatz, had I wanted to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Situation”
Reviews.Author: bbhmg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Berlin many times but on this occasion needed an hotel which was "Central"... We use Easyjet to fly so this hotel came up on their website and after reading the description of the facilities, I decided to take the family for the Christmas Markets weekend.. Our main disappointment was that the hotel did not help us with a smoking room with bath as requested via the Easyjet site and reception categorically told us that Easyjet had not passed on our requests... Yet the hotel were able to supply us with a third request from the same e-mail which was for adjoining rooms for my family. Otherwise it is an ideal jumping off point for all of Berlin since it is next to a U-Bahn which took us everywhere we wanted. The rooms were nice an warm and we slept well before going down for a great selection off the breakfast bar Across the road is the brother hotel (The Kurfurster) which had quality restaurant , fitness center and a bar which makes a change from the Henriette.......... In summary, I can recommend the Henriette as a suitable hotel for a sightseeing visit to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “an excellent base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kevdrwg
Reviews.Content: I wanted to treat myself to a good quality hotel as I was travelling alone and was fed up with hostels - boy did I land on my feet here! I got an apartment overlooking the river which was very spacious and very clean with fab bathroom (I mean REALLY good!) and loads of wardrobe space - it also had a desk, chair and table. The hotel itself is not too big with only 54 rooms which means that the 'bar' downstairs is just a small area in reception where the receptionist can get you a beer - but i wasnt planning on hanging around in the hotel much. One thing that I really loved about this hotel was how near it was to the UBahn! -the entrance is literally outside the hotel and its the U2 line as well (markisches museum) which gets you anywhere you need to go. What is also cool is that just up the road (300m?) there is a Spar supermarket with everything you need (beware of German opening times though -til 8 at the latest and not at all on sundays). Its true there is not much to do immediately outside but its only 15mins walk to Alexanderplatz and Museumsinsel is close too. I did visit Kudamm etc but find the old East is much more to my taste - and a damn site more interesting to boot! So if youre looking for a bit of quality at a good price but arent the kind to hang around and eat/drink in the hotel then this place is ideal - get yourself a good city map and off you go!!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: Bequia1
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to find a nice, somewhat affordable hotel in Berlin for a recent trip, and wasn't at all sure where to go. All I knew was that I wanted to stay in East Berlin. I stumbled on the Hotel Henriette in a guide book, and it ended up being a very good choice. It's not as "drop dead" spectacular as some of the new modern chain hotels in Postdamerplatz, but it was certainly more intimate, and the staff took good care of me. Although the surrounding area may feel a bit out of the way, the hotel is actually in a very central location, on the Spee River virtually across from the "Museum Island" with its many museums and the Berliner Dom. The hotel itself is relatively small and modern (and as yet undiscovered by Americans), but it fits with the look and feel of the eastern half of the city. My room had built-in furniture (a bit like a ship) and was on the somewhat small side, like most European hotel rooms, but it was very comfortable and had tons of drawer space and all modern amenities. It also faced the river; a nice bonus (I suggest requesting a river view). The hotel has a nice restaurant and bar, and offers an excellent free breakfast. The staff were courteous and helpful. I would recommend the Hotel Henriette to anyone looking for a bit of (affordable) calm in the midst of this sprawling, ever-changing city.

HotelInfo.Name: Derag Hotel Henriette
HotelInfo.Address: Neue Rossstrasse 13, 10179 Berlin, Germany
